question: Good evening, sir.
answer: Yes. This way. The handiwork of an extremely sick individual. Youve read the reports. Not much to go on. We know nothing about him, except that he likes to cut them... Always the same type of blade. Forensics match in each case... Anyway, it's all in the reports, read them for yourself. Why are you wearing that thing on your face?

question: Germs, sir. These places are full of them.
answer: I see. One things for sure, hes ambitious. Youll be a busy man from now on.

question: What about Thompson, sir? Wasnt this his case?
answer: Thompson suffered a kind of severe delusion or some damn thing. Anyway he isnt with us any longer. The case is yours. Go through his files. Take what you need. By the way, hows your mother?

question: Shes getting better, thanks. She...
answer: Lets go, Bumstead. So much to do and so little time.

question: Dammit!
answer: Sorry, sir.

question: Dont ever sneak up on me like that! Who are you?
answer: Patricia Crenshaw. Im your new assistant.

question: I didnt requisition a secretary.
answer: The Chief-Inspector thought you might need a hand. Ive taken the liberty and had Inspector Thompsons office searched, as I believe you instructed. All clear now, sir. They found several more traps and things were filed under pretty strange categories... Poor man.

question: Good.
answer: You wont regret this, sir.

question: What? I dont drink coffee. A cup of tea would be good. Milk and no sugar. These are the investigations of a madman. He has fabricated an entire bizarre paranoid delusion with no internal logic whatever. This is a mess. A horrible mess. Its the second time now. Look at this! You typed this report?
answer: Yes, sir. Anything wrong?

question: Wrong? Look at this!
answer: It seems fine.

question: Fine? Look here! How can I submit this?
answer: Im sorry...

question: Do you wash your hands before you type things?
answer: Why, yes.

question: Well be more careful, please.
answer: Yes, sir. The Chief-Inspector said he would see you now.

question: What is it?
answer: A formality. I need to speak with Thompson. Officially I need your written permission.

question: Why do you want to speak to him?
answer: A hunch. He might be able to... Its extremely important to my investigation...

question: Ill be the judge of that. Anything else?
answer: Actually, I was wondering, sir, if you could let me have a few uniforms, to follow up for me... Lost something?

question: I need something to keep me awake.
answer: Looks like you need a haircut to me.

question: Thanks. Just some pills.
answer: Only two bucks. Shave as well... Relax. Sure! Tell you what - let me cut yer hair, give ya watcha need half price. Cant argue at that!

question: Sell maps?
answer: What of?

question: The city. I need to get to the ocean.
answer: Nope. No maps. Ocean, huh? On vacation? Grandpa thought customers might like some mood music. You still look familiar. Its driving me nuts! Sure I dont know ya from somewhere? Mnunn. Cold lately. That night, couple weeks ago. That was real cold. Remember that?

question: Not really...
answer: Yeah, Im like that. Senility says the wife. But she sure cant complain. Heh. The erector set still works good. And this aint no fucking rug! Ghead. Feel it! All mine!

question: Beware! The night is deadly. There is a criminal among us. It could be she! The innocent across the street! Or the temptress next door! Or mister nervy stranger at the back! You are thinking it could be anyone? And youre right! Why, it could even be Mother!
answer: NO. Ah...

question: I am listening. You fornicated?
answer: No. I, ah...

question: You seem restless.
answer: Someones after me.

question: Then we must call the police.
answer: No. I mean... that isnt necessary.

question: I see. Then who is after you? What sins have you committed?
answer: Just let me sit here for a moment? Ill go soon, and stop bothering you.

question: Youre the murderer? Yes! That must be it! Dont kill me!
answer: Shut up! Listen. Walk out quietly. Understand?

question: Dont kill me!
answer: Shut up!

question: How long have you been here?
answer: Maybe ten minutes... Thats strange.

question: Spinning backwards?
answer: Yours too?

question: You remember nothing? Who you are? What you've done?
answer: You know something about me?

question: Ah, that would be cheating, wouldn't it? Is there nothing you remember? Not even a detail? You must try.
answer: You think I haven't been trying! It's like there was never anything there. Just water.

question: Water?
answer: Waves... A beach. A woman whispering. That's all. I need to stay awake. Do you have any pills?

question: What does she say? The woman.
answer: Asks my name. Over and over. Just like a broken record. Only thing is, I can't answer. I've no idea what my name is.

question: Your name is John White.
answer: That's what people keep telling me.

question: Bad dreams?
answer: Yes.

question: Tell me about them... If you like.
answer: You're supposed to be my doctor, right?

question: That's right. I am your doctor.
answer: Known me for long?

question: Well... I cannot say... You don't know the answer to that?
answer: I told you, I can't remember a thing!

question: We won't get anywhere like this. Please. Let's take things in easy steps... Put simply... a penetration of the left parieto-occipital area of the cranium... complicated by inflammation that resulted in adhesions of the brain to the meninges. Without going into detail... the formation of scar tissue altered the configuration of the lateral ventricles, producing incipient atrophy of the medulla...
answer: Did she drown? The woman you told me about?

question: Not exactly. She was found in a canal, disembowelled. Throat cut. Blood drained. The body wrapped in a bed-sheet.
answer: Horrible...

question: You remember nothing, eh? Let me show you something. Formation of memories is the most important of brain functions. We are little more than a sum of memories. From them we reference who we are, where we're going. Without a past we are nothing. This is why you are so interesting.
answer: I'm nothing then.

question: Anything but, my friend. It feels no pain.
answer: Can I get my life back?

question: Maybe. We know of two kinds of memory. Firstly, declarative memory. And then there is procedural memory. Follow? Research on simple animals can be... useful. To show us where memory storing systems are located, for example. I am building an experiment with hamsters next. Cute little things. Listen to me talk! You must be hungry. Whole damn wing lost power. Wiring's old. Keep meaning to get it fixed. Here we are. Ah. Beautiful! Head and all! Just how I like 'em!
answer: I'm sorry. About before.

question: I don't blame you for getting angry. You are in a frustrating situation. You must be patient though. Trust me completely. I'm here to help. It can't wait?
answer: Still kicking, huh?

question: Ah, nearly done. So tell me about your dreams. I'm very interested.
answer: Just the typical fabrications of a distorted mind. You know, chased by mysterious men in black, that kind of thing...

question: Ah, our friends in black... they are not just a figment of your imagination you know, in fact none of what you are experiencing is anything but real. I know everything about you. You have no choice but to trust me. Scarey, isn't it? Are you feeling alright? What are you doing?
answer: I have to go...

question: You can't go yet. We've got so much to talk about... You're tired. You need to lie down.
answer: Those pills...

question: What is it, Crenshaw? Dammit. Very efficient, as usual, Crenshaw. Remind me to give you my watch. It needs fixing.
answer: Where are we going?

question: Shut-up. Gesundheit!
answer: What are we doing here?

question: The men in black - they're the killers.
answer: You're a liar!

question: No, it's the truth.
answer: So you're telling me the truth this time? Is that it!

question: If you would only take this, inject it in your brain, everything would be much clearer.
answer: Not that again...

question: Everyone get's one - very much like this... But this one's special. It will help you understand, everything... Anton - I mean, John, there has been an experiment, a dangerous experiment. I arranged it. It was a lie from the beginning. It almost worked, but things did not go as they should have. You have been left - blank. You can change this, all this. But you must take it.
answer: You've been working too hard.

question: Please! Don't be foolish! Time is short. Let me show you something. Look at this syringe.
answer: Why?

question: Don't ask stupid questions. Look at it. Concentrate. Imagine the syringe rising. Picture it floating above the table. Do it!
answer: It's a trick.

question: No it isn't. You are doing it! Now raise it over the glass and...
answer: Oh, sorry...

question: Doctor! What brings you here?
answer: Just visiting my patient.

question: Really? And how is his state of mind?
answer: He's seriously disturbed...

question: You seem a little edgy. Everything okay?
answer: Yes, of course. Everything's fine...

question: To tell you the truth, I'm glad we've run into each other like this. Maybe you can help me tidy some loose ends.
answer: Loose ends?

question: I thought it would make more sense. I'm getting the pieces, but when I put it together it feels like... Like you're telling me about somebody else's life...
answer: It's the truth... I need you. I know you're innocent.

question: How do you know I'm innocent?
answer: Of course you are. You couldn't do those terrible things. Come home with me - maybe things will make sense then...

question: I can't do that. It's dangerous. What about my parents? Do you know where I can find them?
answer: They're dead, John. You have an uncle. You were very close. This is where he lives. I'm sure he would like to see you.

question: What's your name? Alright. Here... Know this place? How do I get there? Tell me.
answer: That's easy. You...

question: Go away! Bumstead? Can't let you in... sorry.
answer: I'm on the serial killer case, need to talk.

question: Not that. Anything else.
answer: You don't look so well... C'mon, let me in Thompson.

question: I can't talk about that. As long as you understand, that's all. Pull up some garbage - make yourself at home. They've taken my mind, my memories...
answer: What? Who has?

question: Is that your idea of a joke? I don't remember... Take my advice, Bumstead. Get off this case. Now.
answer: What is going on?

question: Get away! Leave me alone! It's - it's disgusting, I know...
answer: Jesus! We have to get you to a doctor...

question: No... No doctor...
answer: But... How long has this been happening?

question: All the same entry wounds. It's definitely him. She lives... lived here. A prostitute.
answer: The other one?

question: His wife.
answer: Jesus. Small world. Where's the photographer?

question: No one available. We'll interrogate them anyway. This is the family of the victim - apparently they were in the apartment when he committed... Oh, yes... They don't speak English...
answer: How will we interrogate them?

question: Well, sir... I don't know exactly.
answer: It's alright. I won't hurt you.

question: I have called this meeting for a purpose, yes? It is clear to you we are - unhappy, yes?
answer: Yes, of course. I...

question: The tuning failed - when our agents arrived he was gone. He knows things - predicts things. Explain to us, Doctor. Why is the situation this way? Yes?
answer: I'm not certain I fully understand myself...

question: No excuses, dearest Doctor! Answers. Yes? You said this would be containable! Nothing works this time. Why is this so?
answer: I - ah - I... it's a little cold in here don't you think?

question: Who is it?
answer: Won't say. Says he must talk to you.

question: Put it through... This is Bumstead. Who is this? I need everything on the Jonathan White case.
answer: Yes, sir. Everything?

question: All the important stuff. Wrap it up for me. Please - I'm in a hurry. Why give yourself up?
answer: I - ah - couldn't think of anything else to do. I thought maybe you know something... I'm scared.

question: That was a pretty good escape act at the station. How did you do that?
answer: I woke up in a subway. I don't know how I got there. People... after me.

question: Who?
answer: I don't know who they are.

question: Why are they after you?
answer: Don't know that either.

question: I didn't tell you the entire reason I helped you. It started with two little girls. Twins. Used to play with them when I was young. Couldn't remember for the life of me what they looked like, then I understood why... They didn't have faces.
answer: What?

question: That's right. Just seamless flesh across the front of their heads. No mistake. I just hadn't remembered it that way. Up until then they had been normal little girls in my memory. That's not all. Once I started examining them, all sorts of things about my life, had... inconsistencies. It was like a game. I would think about a person or a place, or an event. Then I would turn the lights off. Sit down in a comfortable chair... And study each detail of this subject. Everything was liquid beneath a thin surface that had always seemed solid to me... Is there anything you haven't told me about this business? Even the most insignificant thing? Go on.
answer: Well. The only thing I've been certain of, all this time, is that I need to get to the ocean. The point is no one seems to know how to get there.

question: Nothing. I don't know anything! Please, they'll kill me...
answer: I think it's time you introduced us to your little friends.

question: In there.
answer: Just like that? What is this place?

question: What the hell is that? Quick. My car.
answer: What now?

question: This ocean business... I know where I can find a map. I need to go back to the station. Where will you be?
answer: I'll go see an uncle of mine. Five - one - eight - three - double six - three...

question: Where can we meet?... Alright. Good...
answer: Look! This is a good one!

question: What is that door?
answer: Which one?

question: There. Behind the cabinet. Where does it go?
answer: Such a joker! Like your father.

question: No. Have a look. You see it?
answer: Yes.

question: Where does it lead?
answer: It must be a closet or something. Don't trip over. It's dark up there. John, I didn't see you there. What is that? Filthy beast! Shoo! Go on! Shoo!
